DOC.brief_summary: Analysis of stored seat-pressures in SCI patients during a 4-week use of an on-board device. During this period, patients write in an agenda noteworthy events that could occur while they're using their wheelchair. A control is done every week and the device can be changed until it is returned at the end of the study period.
DOC.brief_title: Preliminary Study Leading to Prevention of Pressure Ulcers by the Use of an On-board Device : Ergonomic Assessment of Wheelchair-seat Pressures in Spinal Cord Injured (SCI) Patients ( PRESDIE)
DOC.detailed_description: - inclusion visit : recovery of the signed informed-consent form, clinical examination, skin control, seat-pressures control, device 9-position control, delivery of the agenda for noteworthy events - 3 follow-up visits : noteworthy events check, skin control, cushioncloth control, device 9-position control - return visit : device return, agenda return, skin control, seat-pressures control
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria : Patient is male or female, aged ≥ 18 Patient accepting the initial assessment and the following visits during the protocol Written informed consent has been obtained Patient having a social assurance Spinal cord injury ≤ C6 stable Spinal cord trauma > 1 an Main mode of ambulation : own manual wheelchair Exclusion criteria : Aged ≤ 18 Adults under guardianship Patients do not speak French, refusing or unable to be followed Pregnant or lactating women Person deprived of their liberty by judicial or administrative decision Person hospitalised without consent Pelvic pressure ulcer ongoing Cognitive disorder incompatible with the use of the device, understanding and conduct of the study
DOC.keyword: Pressure ulcer, spinal cord injury, on-board device
